title: 5 Goldman Sachs Stocks to Buy with Over 20% Upside Potential
text:
Goldman Sachs (NYSE:GS) is keeping a bullish view on the economy’s outlook. “Our economists expect that a U.S. recession is unlikely during the next two years,” the firm’s chief U.S. equity strategist David Kostin said recently. He believes the U.S. will narrowly avoid a recession, with the S&P 500 rising 4% to 3,100 points by the end of 2019. This should then climb 14% to 3,400 by the end of 2020.

So what now? Here we take a closer look at five stocks to buy with bullish calls from Goldman Sachs. Furthermore, as you will see, each of these stocks shows over 20% upside potential from current levels. That means now is a particularly compelling time to buy in. Let’s take a closer look at which stocks are on Goldman Sachs’ buy list now:

InvestorPlace - Stock Market News, Stock Advice & Trading Tips

Stocks to Buy: Uber Technologies (UBER)

Stocks to Buy: Uber Technologies (UBER) More

Source: NYCStock / Shutterstock.com

Uber (NYSE:UBER) stock is down 17% since its initial public offering (IPO). But Goldman’s Heath Terry isn’t going anywhere. The analyst has a buy rating on the stock with a $56 price target. With shares trading at such weak levels, his price target now indicates attractive upside potential of 66%.

“While there are considerable risks in ownership across the space given the intense competition, regulatory issues, and operating pressures, we continue to believe the risk/reward in owning the leader in this space is favorable and we remain Buy-rated,” Terry explained.

Even though Q2 earnings failed to impress, Terry took heart from the fact that bookings were in-line with consensus forecasts and its adjusted EBITDA beat consensus. In addition, UBER also offered initial FY19 guidance that bracketed consensus for gross bookings and was better than consensus for adjusted EBITDA losses.

Uber still has a Strong Buy analyst consensus rating. That’s with an average price target of $54 (57% upside potential). For instance, SunTrust’s Youssef Squali summed up the bull case succinctly: “We remain positive on UBER post solid, though noisy, 2Q19 results… UBER remains a generational company compounding at scale, taking advantage of a massively inefficient transportation market.” Interested in Uber? Get a free UBER Stock Research Report.





Alibaba (BABA)

Stocks to Buy: Alibaba (BABA) More

Goldman Sachs doesn’t just have a buy rating on Alibaba (NYSE:BABA) — it has a Conviction Buy rating. This recommendation is reserved for stocks the firm holds in particularly high regard.

Covering the Chinese e-commerce giant is Goldman’s Piyush Mubayi, who reiterated his bullish call following better-than-expected fiscal Q1 earnings results. His BABA stock price target currently stands at $236 indicating upside potential of 34% from the current $176 share price.

“We remain impressed with Alibaba’s overall leverage to China consumption growth given its strategy, positioning, ability to build new businesses (such as new retail) and its execution,” Mubayi told clients. “We expect Alibaba to continue to invest for future growth on multiple fronts.”

The analyst highlights the company’s growing cloud and financial businesses: “In our view, the continuous investment in cloud technology demonstrates Alibaba’s determination to solidify its leading position in the industry and take up more market share in the future,” he said. “We believe Ant Financial will continue to be the ‘enabler’ of Alibaba’s New Retail strategy and help the company navigate the globalization road map.”

Even without co-founder Jack Ma at the helm, analysts continue to favor Alibaba stock. In the last three months, 16 analysts have published back-to-back buy ratings on the stock. Their average price target stands at $228. Get the BABA Stock Research Report.
